intro: Brimeura font-queri, commonly known as the Font-Queri's brimeura, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinct, often pungent scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
